START.question: Do you think there is anything you are experiencing at this very moment, or is that uncertain?

options.label: I don’t think there is anything real to experience.

Q2.question: Right now, does what you experience feel like one continuous, unified whole, or like many separate things?

Q2a.question: Is this because everything genuinely feels unified, or because you cannot distinguish parts yet?

options.label: I just can’t distinguish the parts.

Q3.question: Do you notice that some things happen or appear again, or is everything always completely new?

options.label: Some things happen or appear again.

Q4.question: When things seem to repeat, do you think any are literally the same individual persisting over time, just recurring instances of a kind, or is it impossible to tell?

options.label: Just recurring instances of a kind.

Q5a.question: Is your difficulty telling whether something is the same individual or another instance due to a real fact you simply can't know, or is the distinction itself confused or meaningless?

options.label: There is a fact, but I can’t know it.
The distinction is confused or meaningless.

Q5b.question: Do you think you cannot tell whether something is the same individual because of limitations in attention or perception, or because it's impossible in principle to know?

Q6.question: When you stop paying attention to a thing that seems to persist, does it keep existing even when unperceived, or does it only exist while noticed?

Q6a.question: Is your uncertainty because the question is conceptually confused, or because it is genuinely difficult to answer?

options.label: The question is unclear or confused.

Q7.question: When you notice recurring kinds or patterns, are they independent features of the world or imposed by the mind?

Q7a.question: If patterns are imposed by the mind, are they arbitrary conventions or shaped by how we experience the world?

Q7b.question: If recurring kinds exist independently, do they exist separately from instances, only within instances, or not at all except as resemblances?

options.label: Do not exist independently; only resemblances.

Q8.question: If things seem to persist unperceived, do they depend only on minds, exist independently, or depend on both minds and reality?

options.label: Depend on both minds and the structure of reality.

Q9.question: If things depend on minds, do they depend on your own mind, minds in general, or collective/social mind?

options.label: Depend on my own mind alone.
Depend on collective or social minds.

Q10.question: If things exist independently of minds, do you perceive them exactly as they are, or could perception misrepresent them?

Q11.question: Do you perceive them directly as they are, or only through how they appear?

Q12.question: Do appearances give us access to reality, is the true nature beyond reach, or is the question meaningless?
